snippet: A judge’s decision that benefits could be reduced in a bankruptcy proceeding has recast the landscape for pensions and given distressed cities leverage to backtrack on their promises.
lead_paragraph: A judge’s decision that benefits could be reduced in a bankruptcy proceeding has recast the landscape for pensions and given distressed cities leverage to backtrack on their promises.
abstract: News analysis; decision by Judge Steven W Rhodes allowing reduction of benefits in Detroit's bankruptcy proceedings has recast the landscape of pensions and given distressed cities leverage to backtrack on their promises.

headline.main: In Detroit Ruling, Threats to Promises and Assumptions
headline.print_headline: In Detroit Ruling, Threats to Promises and Assumptions

keywords.value: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees
keywords.name: organizations
